results.body:
Keira Knightley's recent appearance at the Moet British Independent Film Awards has reignited rumors that the actress is pregnant. Though Knightley and husband, James Righton, have not confirmed the rumors, talk of an addition to the family has floated around since November.

Page Six says that multiple sources have confirmed the pregnancy, and that Keira is well past her third month of pregnancy. This would be Knightley's first child. Though the award show was sponsored by Moet, Keira avoided drinking. Also, Keira's loose-fitting Rocha dress that she wore is a departure from her usual style. Rumors first began in November when gossip magazines circulated that the star could be expecting.

The source said that Keira has been focused on covering up her growing pregnancy.

"Keira and her stylist have been putting together looks that hide her growing bump."

Don't expect Keira to be a stay-at-home mom. When she spoke to Vogue in 2013, Knightley said that she would not give up acting if she and Righton did have children.

"Would I want to be a stay-at-home mother? No. On the other hand, you should be allowed to do that, as should men, without being sneered at."

Hello Magazine says that Keira has also been vocal recently about starting a family. Knightley said she would be hesitant about encouraging her children to take up the acting profession.

"It can be completely heartbreaking for most people who do it, because the amount of rejection is enormous. And it doesn't matter what kind of person you are, it's impossible for that not to take a toll... So I would say to my daughter, 'Be a doctor or a lawyer - something stable and useful.'"

Keira was nominated on Wednesday for a Screen Actors Guild supporting actress award for her role as Joan Clarke in The Imitation Game. Her co-star Benedict Cumberbatch was also nominated for a SAG award. Other nominated actresses include Meryl Streep for Into the Woods, Naomi Watts for St. Vincent, Emma Stone in Birdman, and Patricia Arquette in Boyhood.

Keira married her husband James Righton in May 2013. Righton is a co-vocalist and keyboardist for the Klaxons, a London-based pop band.

Knightley also sparked controversy for her recent photo shoot with Patrick Demarchalier. Keira posed topless for the shoot and demanded that her photos remain unedited to protest Photoshop editing of women's bodies, as reported by the Inquisitr.

As Keira is concerned about covering up her baby bump, it seems unlikely that the star will confirm these sources any time soon.

[Photo Source: Harpers Bazaar]

results.body:
The Imitation Game actress and her husband James Righton are expecting their first baby together.

Keira Knightley has rounded off a memorable 2014 after reports that she's expecting her first baby.

The 29 year old British actress is pregnant with her first child with her husband James Righton, a former member of the recently demised indie-dance group Klaxons, whom she married in the south of France early in 2013.

Keira Knightley and husband James Righton are expecting their first child together

According to reports by PageSix, Knightley is already past her first trimester. She was spotted avoiding alcohol at Sunday's Moet British Independent Spirit Awards, and was wearing a loose-fitting gown outfit in contrast to her usual tight-fit style, which prompted professional celebrity spotters to speculate whether the actress was expecting.

In the past few days, Knightley has celebrated a Screen Actors Guild Award nomination and a Golden Globe nod for her role in The Imitation Game, the film concerning British WW2 codebreaker Alan Turing and starring Benedict Cumberbatch.

More: Keira Knightley says topless photoshoot was in order to protest the use of Photoshop

In an interview with Vogue back in 2012 she spoke of her desire to have children in the future, but that she intended to maintain her career at the same time. "Would I want to be a stay-at-home mother? No. On the other hand, you should be allowed to do that, as should men, without being sneered at."

In an interview with Glamour this year, she reiterated her point. "I mean, not to have the freedom to do that [if you are male] is as bad as saying it's a woman's duty to look after the children." With her husband's band no longer in operation, it seems as though Righton will be being expected to pull his weight with the childcare.

More: Gone Girl wins top honour and The Imitation Game wins 4 awards at Hollywood Film Awards

12 DECEMBER 2014 Keira Knightley has confirmed that she is pregnant with her first child. Representatives for the actress told Elle UK that rumours she is expecting are true, but that there would not be any more news about the pregnancy at the moment.

The news that the Love Actually star and her Klaxons musician husband James Righton are to become parents comes the day after reports suggested Keira has been avoiding alcohol and wearing more loose fitting clothing than normal.

London-born Keira made a red carpet appearance on Sunday night at the Moet British Independent Film Awards and while she showed no visible signs of a baby bump, the Daily Mail reported Keira "steered clear from any champagne or alcohol" during the evening.

Keira's eagle-eyed fashion fans also suggested that the textured dress she chose for the event was a departure from her more tailored style and its flared skirt wouldn't be figure-hugging.

The British actress, who tied the knot with James in 2013, is believed to be in the first trimester and a source told Page Six that "Keira and her stylist have been putting together looks that hide her growing bump".

2015 will be a memorable year for the 29-year-old star. Not only will she be preparing to welcome her first child, she is also expected to hit the awards circuit with her latest film The Imitation Game.

On Thursday both Keira and her co-star Benedict Cumberbatch were nominated for SAG Awards for their roles in the Second World War drama.
results.title: Keira Knightley confirms her pregnancy

results.body:
Keira Knightley has confirmed she and husband James Righton are expecting their first child together.

Keira Knightley has confirmed she is pregnant.

The 'Imitation Game' actress and her musician husband James Righton, 31, will welcome their first child into the world next spring.

A spokesperson for the 29-year-old beauty said rumours the couple, who got married in May 2013, are expecting a baby are true, but told ELLEUK.com today (12.12.14) that the actress will not be making any further comment about her pregnancy.

The official announcement comes just one day after multiple sources claimed Keira was already in her second trimester.

The British star previously revealed she would love to star in a film about infertility.

Discussing her fantasy film script last summer, she said: ''The horrendous issue of trying to have a baby when you can't.

''I've seen friends who've been through this, it seems like one of the most dramatic things that can happen to half of the population - and actually, the other half as well because, my god, the unbelievable toll it takes on male partners - and there are no good films about it.''

The 'Atonement' star also previously admitted she was eager to have children, but insisted she would never give up her career to raise a family.

Speaking last year, she said: ''I don't want to deny my femininity. But would I want to be a stay-at-home mother? No. On the other hand, you should be allowed to do that, as should men, without being sneered at.''

Keira and James started dating in February 2011 and tied the knot in front of just 11 guests in Mazan in the South of France last year.

results.body:
Keira Knightley and James Righton are expecting their first child (Getty Images)Keira Knightley has a lot to celebrate!

The British actress has just been nominated for a Screen Actors Guild Award and Golden Globe Award for her supporting work in The Imitation Game, but Keira won't be toasting the exciting news with champagne. Multiple media outlets including Us Weekly and E! News are reporting she's pregnant.

Keira covers up her bump in NYC (Splash News)This will be the first child for Knightley, 29, and her husband, James Righton. According to reports, she is more than three months along.

Righton -- the 31-year-old co-vocalist and keyboardist for London-based band Klaxons -- and Keira tied the knot in a low-key ceremony in France in the summer of 2013. It was so low key, in fact, that the fashion icon recycled a Chanel dress to wear on her wedding day.

The Begin Again actress previously told Vogue that while she hopes to have a family one day, she won't give up her career to do so.

"Would I want to be a stay-at-home mother? No," she said. "On the other hand, you should be allowed to do that, as should men, without being sneered at."

When speaking with Elle U.K. in June, Keira was asked if she would encourage her hypothetical teenage daughter to be an actress.

"Oh, 100%, I'd absolutely tell her not to. I would 150 million trillion per cent be totally discouraging of [her] doing anything like that."

She continued, "If the kid is going to do that then they have to do it on their own. And I would say teenage years should be done privately. You should be going out and getting unbelievably drunk, getting into ridiculous situations, making mistakes. That's what that time of life is about and we should do that privately, one million trillion zillion per cent. Saying that, I don't regret it -- I wouldn't do my life any differently."

While it is unknown whether Keira has a little girl or boy on the way, one thing is for sure... her maternity style is going to be awesome this awards season.
results.title: Keira Knightley Is Pregnant, Expecting First Child With James Righton - Yahoo Celebrity UK

results.body:
Keira Knightley is pregnant with her first child.

Speculation has been rife for the past month that the British actress and her Klaxons singer husband James Righton are expecting a baby together and the happy news was confirmed today (Fri) by Keira's representative.

Rumours circulated that the 29-year-old was pregnant when she 'steered clear from any champagne or alcohol' during an appearance on Sunday night at the Moet British Independent Film Awards.

Now her representative has confirmed the news to Elle UK although they added that no further details would be released.

On Sunday (Dec 7), Keira was presented with the Variety Award alongside her The Imitation Game co-stars Benedict Cumberbatch and Mark Strong.

She has also been nominated for Outstanding Performance by a Female Actor in a Supporting Role at both the upcoming 2015 Screen Actors Guild and the Golden Globe Awards for her role in The Imitation Game.

The actress - who has been with James, 31, since February 2011 - has made no secret of her desire to have children, but has previously insisted she would never give up her career to raise a family.

In 2012, she told Vogue magazine: "I don't want to deny my femininity. But would I want to be a stay-at-home mother? No. On the other hand, you should be allowed to do that, as should men, without being sneered at."

Speculation about Keira's pregnancy was fuelled last month by a 'family source' who spoke to an American magazine.

"Keira and James are thrilled," the source told Star. "This wasn't planned, but that is how they wanted it."

In November, the source added that Keira is around 12 weeks pregnant and she has called on the help of her stylist to put together outfits that hide her growing baby bump.

Keira then added to the growing speculation by drinking nothing stronger than water while out in New York to promote Imitation Game.

She said her abstinence was due to an early alarm call the next morning as she was appearing on TV show Good Morning America, but her protestations have done little to stem the speculation.

"It's one way to ruin a party," Keira told the New York Times. "When they go, 'You have to get up at 5:30 in the morning the next day'.

"There are some really bad stories about people doing that and then going on these shows," she said, while pointing to her glass of water.

"You don't know what could come out of your mouth after a night out."

results.body:
Keira Knightley is pregnant with her first child.

A representative for the 29-year-old actress confirmed to Elle UK on Friday morning that Keira and her musician husband James Righton are expecting a baby together.

The spokesperson added no further details on the pregnancy would be offered at this time.

Keira made a high-profile red carpet appearance on Sunday night at the Moet British Independent Film Awards, displaying no visible signs of a baby bump in an embroidered ivory fur-trimmed dress by Rocha.

The British star is said to have 'steered clear from any champagne or alcohol' throughout the night, where she presented her The Imitation Game co-star Benedict Cumberbatch with the Variety Award alongside Mark Strong.

This is the latest happy news for the talented thespian, after she was nominated for Outstanding Performance by a Female Actor in a Supporting Role at both the upcoming 2015 Screen Actors Guild and the Golden Globe Awards for her role in The Imitation Game.

The Atonement actress - who has been with James, 31, since February 2011 - has made no secret of her desire to have children, but has previously insisted she would never give up her career to raise a family.

Speaking in 2012, she told Vogue magazine: 'I don't want to deny my femininity. But would I want to be a stay-at-home mother? No. On the other hand, you should be allowed to do that, as should men, without being sneered at.'

Speaking to Elle UK last summer, Keira appeared to have children on the brain when she discussed her fantasy film script.

She said of the imagined plot: 'The horrendous issue of trying to have a baby when you can't.

'I've seen friends who've been through this, it seems like one of the most dramatic things that can happen to half of the population - and actually, the other half as well because, my god, the unbelievable toll it takes on male partners - and there are no good films about it.'

In recent weeks, Keira has been jet-setting to the UK, US and China - among other destinations - on the promotional trail for The Imitation Game, but has displayed no visible signs of a baby bump at any of her numerous photocalls.

Keira and Klaxons star James started dating in February 2011, before tying the knot in an intimate ceremony in Mazan, a small town in the South of France, back in May 2013, with just 11 guests in attendance.

Speaking to NME about their nuptials, James recently said: 'It was the greatest day ever, it was fantastic. We're still high from it. It was about two weeks ago, it was a big party.

'I just fell in love with someone who happens to be amazing. We had a beautiful wedding and there was a lot of love.'

Speaking to Glamour magazine in June, Keira joked that she decided to get married because it 'seemed like a fun thing to do'.

'When James proposed, I just thought, "Well, never done that before". It seemed like a fun thing to do,' she confessed.

The actress impressed fashion critics with her rather thrifty approach to bridal glamour, choosing a couture Chanel wedding dress she had previously worn to a red carpet event five years previously.

But Keira later admitted the wedding was the gown's last outing, after a friend accidentally knocked a glass of red wine down her on her big day.

She explained: 'It's now got red wine spilled down the front because the last time I wore it my friend went like this [she juts out her elbows] and now it's everywhere. I didn't quite realise the extent of it until I got home.

'It's quite impressively splattered. But, hey, a good night is a good night and when a dress has had its time, maybe it's had its time.

'I'm pretty sure I can get it out but, if I can't, I'm happy with the memory of a good night and the story of how the dress got destroyed.'

Prior to her romance with James, Keira had long-term relationships with Fifty Shades of Grey star Jamie Dornan and Homeland's Rupert Friend

In October 2015, Keira is set to make her Broadway debut when she takes on the role of a doomed heroine in a new stage adaptation of Therese Raquin, British playwright Helen Edmundson's adaptation of the French classic 1867 novel by Emile Zola.

results.body:
Actress is expecting her first child with husband James Righton

After heavy speculation for the past few weeks that Keira Knightley was possibly expecting her first child with husband James Righton the happy news has apparently been confirmed. Hurrah.

Rumours have been rife that Keira was expecting after she stepped out in numerous baggy outfits and was noted to be snubbing alcohol at the Moet sponsored British Independent Spirit Awards on Sunday night. The 29-year-old Hollywood actress is reportedly "more than three months" pregnant with the Klaxons singer's baby, and the news has been confirmed by "several sources" to Page Six.

Keira and James got hitched in May 2013 in the south of France, but she has been quizzed on the subject of babies several times in recent years, During a chat with Vogue back in 2012 she gave her take on whether or not she believed in being a stay at home mum.

Keira Knightley and James Righton at The Spirit Awards on Sunday (WENN)

She said: "I'm glad that the subject is coming up again. I remember doing interviews, and people would ask, as if it was a joke, 'So you mean you are a feminist?' As though feminism couldn't be discussed unless we were making fun of it. I don't want to deny my femininity. But would I want to be a stay-at-home mother? No. On the other hand, you should be allowed to do that, as should men, without being sneered at."

And this summer Keira continued the debate - hinting that she thinks Dad's should be free to share the responsibility of giving up work to care for their baby.

She said: "I think it's about equality. I was talking to a male friend about this the other day who's just had a baby girl, and because he's the one staying home to look after her, he went to this mother-and-baby class, and all the mothers were going, 'Oh, is the baby having a day with Dad?' I mean, not to have the freedom to do that [if you are male] is as bad as saying it's a woman's duty to look after the children."

The official announcement comes just one day after multiple sources claimed Keira was already in her second trimester.

The British star previously revealed she would love to star in a film about infertility.

Discussing her fantasy film script last summer, she said: "The horrendous issue of trying to have a baby when you can't.

"I've seen friends who've been through this, it seems like one of the most dramatic things that can happen to half of the population - and actually, the other half as well because, my god, the unbelievable toll it takes on male partners - and there are no good films about it."

The 'Atonement' star also previously admitted she was eager to have children, but insisted she would never give up her career to raise a family.

Speaking last year, she said: "I don't want to deny my femininity. But would I want to be a stay-at-home mother? No. On the other hand, you should be allowed to do that, as should men, without being sneered at."

Keira and James started dating in February 2011 and tied the knot in front of just 11 guests in Mazan in the South of France last year.

The notoriously private couple - who married in May 2013 after two years of dating - have been keeping quiet on the pregnancy rumours until today. A rep confirmed that Keira is in fact pregnant but won't be making any further comment.

The reason that everyone was so suspicious about Keira's potential baby bump was because of her noticeably shifted style. The stylish actress has been seen out and about more recently in distinctly looser-fitted getups. Her slim figure is usually kitted out in tight dresses but for her last few events, she has opted for chiffon dresses which don't give too much away.

Keeping it super casual while out and about in New York just a few weeks ago, Keira looked effortlessly cool in a pair of baggy dungarees - but it was this pic that sent the rumour mill into overdrive.

She was on the Jonathon Ross show recently in a baggy chiffon dress and although she displayed no obious signs of a baby bump, the flowing gown certainly differed from many of her tighter-fitting red carpet looks we have seen in the past, like this Chanel dress from March.

She also wore a loose-fitted white floral dress by Holly Fulton during her New York trip and the winning pink Dolce number also had us convinced. These (very early days) maternity looks provide some serious style inspiration and we can't wait to see what she will wear when her bump becomes a little more visible.

Keira joins the likes of Blake Lively and Kate Middleton in the seriously stylish mums-to-be group at the moment. We wonder if they have been swapping notes on how to totally rock their bumps.

Congratulations to Keira! We can't wait to see your maternity looks in full.

results.body:
As soon as the Golden Globe nominations are announced, we start predicting looks for our favorite female nominees. And with the debut of Oscar de la Renta's pre-fall 2015 collection this week, that hunt for award show gowns got a whole lot easier.

The 34 pieces are part of the last collection bearing the fingerprints of the late designer, who passed away in October at the age of 82. The New York Times reviewed the collection, which was completed by his studio director Laura Kim, and about which Kim said, "We tried to make it like he's still here with us. We made big ball gowns, like he likes them." And since Hollywood loves a big ballgown too, we picked three dresses for three Golden Globe-nominated stars to honor his legacy on the red carpet.

Courtesy of Oscar de la Renta; Inset: Tim P. Whitby/Getty

Jennifer Aniston: We're not expecting the Cake actress to go all-out gown at the Globes, but we are expecting her to wear black. This strapless lace design adds some excitement thanks to the gorgeous gold embroidery (and the sheer skirt!). Plus, the midi length would stand out amid all the floor-skimming dresses that are bound to hit the carpet.

Courtesy Oscar de la Renta; Inset: Jim Spellman/WireImage

Emily Blunt: The actress has been jumping into some whimsical dressing territory as she promotes Into the Woods (which nabbed her a nom for Best Actress!), and we're thinking she should keep it that way. This gorgeous floral gown would not only be a hat tip to her film, but also to the impeccable detailing Oscar de la Renta gowns are known for.

Keira Knightley: From the color to the drop waist to the interesting hemline, this dress was made for Keira Knightley. Period.
results.title: Oscar de la Renta's Final Collection Is Here: We Pick Three Dresses We Want to See on Golden Globe Nominees (Hi, Jennifer Aniston!)

results.body:
And while stars are still reacting to their nods from the Hollywood Foreign Press, we've already moved on to pondering what these stylish celebs might wear on January 11.

But in order to do that, we first must look back at what the nominees have worn at past Golden Globes. While most of ladies -- such as Reese Witherspoon, Emma Stone and Jennifer Aniston -- have gone quite a few times and thus have a rich style history on the award show's red carpet. You might be surprised to find out that Keira Knightley has only attended once!

PHOTOS: 2015 Golden Globe Nominations -- See the complete list!

Granted when she did attend (back in 2006) she was breathtaking in a white Valentino gown. So we're confident she's going to come correct in 2015.
results.title: 2015 Golden Globe Nominees: See Reese Witherspoon, Jennifer Aniston, Emma Stone & More Stars' Past Looks

results.body: We're all for embracing seasonal static, but freshly styled, glossy hair is one of winter's most defiant luxuries -- and one that arctic air and tight hats can put a kink in before it reaches second-day perfection. Spotted in SoHo, Keira Knightley protected her shiny waves with an oversize cap, while over in the West Village, Sarah Jessica Parker braved the cold in signature style with a chunky patterned knit. Meanwhile, Reese Witherspoon tamed in-flight frizz by slipping on a roomy beanie after touchdown in L.A. Just in time for your weekend blowout, here's a look at the utilitarian chic of a thick knit cap.
results.title: How to Extend Your Winter Blowout: Keira Knightley, Sarah Jessica Parker, Reese Witherspoon, and More Embrace the Oversize Knit Hat

results.body:
Keira Knightley durante los Premios del Cine Independiente Británico en el Mercado de Old Billingsgate, en Londres. LA PRENSA/AP

La actriz británica Keira Knightley está embarazada de más de tres meses del que será su primer hijo, de acuerdo con informaciones de diversas fuentes sin identificar citadas por el diario New York Post.

La actriz, de 29 años, se casó el 4 de mayo del año pasado, en el sur de Francia, con el músico inglés James Righton, de 31 años, vocalista de la banda Klaxons.

El periódico recuerda que los primeros rumores sobre el posible embarazo de la actriz surgieron en noviembre pasado, cuando se hizo eco de ellos la revista Star .

El pasado domingo por la noche participó en un acto patrocinado por una reconocida marca de champán francés en el que evitó consumir alcohol, dice el Post.

El periódico recuerda que la actriz ha expresado su deseo anteriormente de tener hijos, sin que para ello tenga que renunciar a su carrera artística.

El miércoles se anunció que Knightley había sido nominada para los premios del Sindicato de Actores de EE. UU. (SAG) en la categoría de mejor actriz de reparto por su papel en The Imitation Game .

results.body:
La actriz británica Keira Knightley está esperando su primer hijo junto a su esposo James Righton , el vocalista y tecladista de la banda londinense Klaxons.

La noticia fue entregada en exclusiva por el portal de espectáculos del New York Post, Page Six, donde afirman que fuentes cercanas a la pareja confirmaron que la estrella de "Piratas del Caribe" se convertirá en madre.

Los rumores sobre el estado de la actriz de 29 años surgieron por primera vez en noviembre pasado, cuando la revista Star informó que ella y Righton ya habían recibido la feliz noticia. "Keira y su estilista han estado trabajando juntos en varios looks que ocultan su creciente vientre ", declaró la misma fuente.

De acuerdo a Page Six, Knightley tendría poco más de tres meses de embarazo. La protagonista de "The Imitation Game" tiene, además, doble motivo para celebrar, ya que acaba de ser anunciada entre las nominadas a los Screen Actors Guild Awards en la categoría de Mejor Actriz, por su rol en "The Imitation Game".
results.title: Keira Knightley está embarazada

results.body:
Según rumores que circluan en redes y en algunos medios internacionales, la actriz Keira Knightley podría estar esperando su primer hijo.

De acuerdo a lo reportado por el sitio Perez Hilton, hay muchas personas (y medios como el New York Post) que aseguran que la estrella de 'Anna Karenina' y su esposo, James Righton, vocalista del grupo Klaxons, tienen tres meses de embarazo, aunque ninguno de los dos artistas lo ha confirmado.

Los rumores del embarazo comenzaron a partir de que Keira, casada con James desde mayo de 2013, fue vista en un evento privado de la marca Moët, donde prefirió no tomar nada de alcohol.

results.body:
El año que se acerca parece que será de gandes celebraciones para la actriz Keira Knightley y no solo por todas sus nominaciones a prestigiosos premios como los Globos de Oro o los Screen Actors Guild. La estrella de cine británica encarnará el mejor papel de su vida: mamá.

Los rumores resultaron ser ciertos, la protagonista de The Imitation Game (The Weinstein Company)-que se estrena el día de Navidad - está embarazada de su primer retoño, confirmó People.

FOTOS: Los bebés y embarazos del 2014

El abultado vientre de Knightley ya había levantado sospechas de un embarazo a la vista en noviembre. Sin embargo, la actriz y su esposo, el cantante y tecladista de la banda londinense The Klaxons, James Righton, permanecieron mudos ante las especulaciones.

RELACIONADOS: Keira Knightley disfruta de su matrimonio

Se cree que la estrella de Piratas del Caribe tendría un poco más de tres meses.

Hace dos años, la actriz de 29 años de edad confesó a la revista Vogue que no le gustaría ser una ama de casa, en defensa de su derecho de igualdad con el sexo masculino. "Debería ser permitido [no ser ama de casa], así como [lo hacen] los hombres, sin ser una burla".

Knightley y Righton se casaron en una fastuosa ceremonia en el sur de Francia en mayo del 2013.
results.title: Keira Knightley espera su primer hijo con el cantante James Righton - People en Español

results.body:
La protagonista de la saga "Piratas del Caribe", Keira Knightley, podría estar esperando a su primer hijo junto a su esposo, James Righton, vocalista y tecladista de la banda londinense Klaxons.

"La estrella británica está celebrando porque ella tiene más de tres meses de embarazo", confirmó recientemente el periódico "New York Post".

El domingo pasado, Keira se presentó en la ceremonia de los premios "Moët British Independent Spirit Awards", donde lució un vestido holgado, un atuendo muy diferente a los que suele usar.

Según el sitio New York Post, Keira no probó ninguna bebida alcohólica.

En el pasado, Knightley había confirmado que quería tener hijos sin abandonar su carrera en el cine.

"¿Si me gustaría ser madre y ama de casa? No, pero por otra parte, al igual que cualquier hombre, deberias tener derecho a hacerlo si es lo que quieres", explicó a la revista Vogue.
results.title: Revelan que la protagonista de "Piratas del Caribe" podría estar embarazada

results.title: ¿Keira Knightly está embarazada de su primer hijo?

results.body:
No se suponia que la reconocida y famosa Keira Knightley, de forma más próxima que lejana, se iba a convertir en mamá. Pero eso es finalmente lo que parece que va a suceder a tenor por las refcientes informaciones que nos legan al respeto de la famosa actriz de Piratas del caribe. Todo preparado para que Keira Knightley y su marido James Righton estrenen la familia. Según un prestigioso medio, la feliz pareja se encuentran muy ilusionados, habida cuenta de que ya están esperando un bebé, noticia que ha sacudido el mundo del cie.

Tal y como hemos tenido constancia, el perídoco New York Post ha sido el que afirma tener la confirmación por parte de numerosas fuentes que aseguran que la actriz estaría de unos tres meses.

No se sabe el sexo, pero lo que está claro es que el pequeño o pequeña llegaría en uno de los mejores momentos de la actriz.

Hay que recordar que este año se ha cumplido el primer aniversario de su matrimonio con James Righton, con quien se dio el sí quiero el mes de mayo de 2013.

Cabe destacar que la protagonista de Orgullo y Prejuicio afirmó a la revista Vogue en una pasada entrevista: "¿Si me gustaría ser madre y ama de casa? No. Pero por otra parte, al igual que cualquier hombre, deberías tener derecho a hacerlo si es lo que quieres".

Así las cosas, parece que ahora finalmente los deseos de Keira Knightley se han llevado a cabo y ya queda menos para que su primer hijo venga al mundo.
results.title: Los famosos "Keira Knightley" y "James Righton" van a ser papás - El Portal de los Bolivianos en el Mundo

results.body:
México, D.F.-

Luego de acudir a una gala con un vestido poco ajustado y no probar ni una gota de alcohol en toda la noche, las alarmas se encendieron y comenzaron los rumores de que la actriz Keira Knightley está esperando a su primogénito, lo que ya fue confirmado por fuentes cercanas a la celebridad.

De acuerdo con ABC.es, la protagonista de "Los Piratas del Caribe" se casó con James Righton en mayo pasado y a pocos meses de su boda, la feliz pareja ya espera un bebé, el cual ya lleva 3 meses de gestación.

Estas no son las únicas buenas noticias para la estrella de Hollywood, pues este miércoles se dio a conocer su candidatura a mejor actriz secundaria por su papel en "The Imitation Game" en los premios Screen Actors Guild (SAG).

"Muchas gracias al sindicato de actores. Es tal honor estar nominada por tus compañeros", expresó Knightley, de 29 años, de acuerdo con información del periódico "El Mundo".
results.title: Keira Knightley espera a su primer bebé

Actualizado 11/12/2014 17:37:01 CET

MADRID, 11 Dic. (CHANCE) -

Keira Knightley y su marido James Righton podrían estar de enhorabuena. La pareja estaría esperando la llegada de su primer retoño.

La buena nueva ha sido publicada por el New York Post que afirma tener la confirmación por parte de numerosas fuentes que aseguran que la actriz estaría de unos tres meses.

El pequeño o pequeña llegaría en uno de los mejores momentos de la actriz. Este año se ha cumplido el primer aniversario de su matrimonio con James Righton, con quien se dio el sí quiero el mes de mayo de 2013.

Muy discreta con su vida privada, la protagonista de Orgullo y Prejuicio afirmó a la revista Vogue en una pasada entrevista: "¿Si me gustaría ser madre y ama de casa? No. Pero por otra parte, al igual que cualquier hombre, deberías tener derecho a hacerlo si es lo que quieres".
